snippet: At 13, the Little League pitcher Mo’ne Davis has become one of America’s most famous athletes, and she is already learning to say “no” to some of the ceaseless media requests.
abstract: Mo'ne Davis, who is only 18th girl to have played in 68 years of the Little League World Series and first female pitcher to have thrown a shutout, is one of most-discussed athletes in United States; 13-year-old Davis is taking her fame in stride.
lead_paragraph: At 13, the Little League pitcher Mo’ne Davis has become one of America’s most famous athletes, and she is already learning to say “no” to some of the ceaseless media requests.

headline.seo: Mo’ne Davis Takes Little League World Series Stardom in Stride
headline.main: Sports Illustrated and, Maybe in a Few Years, a Driver’s License
headline.print_headline: Sports Illustrated, Then Back to Junior High
